intro: Neurocallis lomarioides, commonly known as the goldenrod bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and inflated, bladder-like seed pods that split open when mature. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
